page.description: Create a CR-LF delimited string of a single dimensional array's contents.

argument.name: Flag
argument.description: "R" = Blank entries are eliminated in character arrays only.

discussion.p: The <ARRAY>.DUMP() method creates a CR-LF delimited string of a single dimensional array's contents. This is the reverse of the [<ARRAY>.INITIALIZE()] method.
Used in conjunction with the [<ARRAY>.INITIALIZE()] method, this method can be used to copy one array's contents to another, or to eliminate blank entries in an array.
If Flag is "R" blank entries in eliminated. This only applies to character arrays.

section.title: Examples
section.description: Assume an array "A" contains the following elements:
section.example: ? A.DUMP() = Orange Banana Apple Pineapple Mango

section.description: The following script creates a new array that is a duplicate of an array.
The following script erases the blank entries in an array.
section.example:
temp = A.dump("R") A.clear(1, a.SIZE()) A.initialize(temp)
? A = [1] = "Orange" [2] = "Banana" [3] = "Mango" [4] = "" [5] = "" [6] = "" [7] = "" [8] = ""
